pkgmetadata.longdescription:
A rewrite of what was formerly known as "Open Broadcaster Software", software originally designed for recording and streaming live video content, efficiently. Aims to be multi-platform, and improved upon internally.
This is an ebuild fork with more detailed VA-API dependency requirement checks.
For Nouveau VA-API details see https://nouveau.freedesktop.org/wiki/VideoAcceleration/
Environment Variables:
RESTREAM_CLIENTID RESTREAM_HASH TWITCH_CLIENTID TWITCH_HASH YOUTUBE_CLIENTID YOUTUBE_CLIENTID_HASH YOUTUBE_SECRET YOUTUBE_SECRET_HASH
If all of the above are not defined, then streaming integration is disabled for that service.
SECURITY: It recommended to provide a patch to UI/CMakeLists.txt to embed the sensitive data. This is to avoid the possible unsecured storage of sensitive info in /var/db/pkg/${CATEGORY}/${P}/environment.bz2. If you have provided this information as a per-package file or via command line, it should be securely wiped with shred as a precaution for the environment.bz2 and the per-package env. If this information is time limited, a wipe may not be needed. Furthermore, the contents of the /var/tmp/portage/${CATEGORY}/${P} and other unfinished builds may need to be recursively shredded as a precaution. The information in environment.bz2 should be shredded, but it may be unmergable. To fix this, you may overwrite the install without sensitive info or delete every file in the /var/db/pkg/${CATEGORY}/${P}/CONTENTS folder or never providing this information in the first place.
Browser plugin:
The lag time for fixing the the browser plugin could be 4+ days. Expect 1+ day(s) lag time for a new cef-bin to match the upstream latest stable build. Sometimes API changes can be fixed on the same day the cef-bin ebuild has been updated. It is important to update the cef-bin whenever the browser is updated for security reasons.
